Analysis.name: Adverse events - outer retinal folds
Footnotes: Face-down: 4 participants with perfluoron; Face-up: 6 participants with perfluoron
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: This is a 4-arm randomized trial, in which patients were randomized to use PFCO or not as well as prone or supine position after surgery for 5 hours. However, it was unclear whether allocation of interventions was properly concealed. There was no evidence of imbalance in baseline characteristics across the comparison groups.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: The trial was "single-blind" yet it was unclear who was masked to the intervention received. Based on the nature of the intervention, patients and researchers were unlikedly masked. However, there was no evidence of deviations from the intended interventions under the trial context.
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: Data for this outcome was available for all participants randomized.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: Proportions of pariticipants with outer retinal folds were reported at multiple timepoints accordingly.
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: Proportions of pariticipants with outer retinal folds were analyzed accordingly.
Overall.bias.support: The trial was judged to have some concerns in risk of bias due to the randomization process.

Analysis.name: Adverse events - outer retinal folds
Footnotes: Face-down: 2 participants with perfluoron; Face-up: 2 participants with perfluoron
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: This is a 4-arm randomized trial, in which patients were randomized to use PFCO or not as well as prone or supine position after surgery for 5 hours. However, it was unclear whether allocation of interventions was properly concealed. There was no evidence of imbalance in baseline characteristics across the comparison groups.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: The trial was "single-blind" yet it was unclear who was masked to the intervention received. Based on the nature of the intervention, patients and researchers were unlikedly masked. However, there was no evidence of deviations from the intended interventions under the trial context.
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: Data for this outcome was available for all participants randomized.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: Proportions of pariticipants with outer retinal folds were reported at multiple timepoints accordingly.
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: Proportions of pariticipants with outer retinal folds were analyzed accordingly.
Overall.bias.support: The trial was judged to have some concerns in risk of bias due to the randomization process.

Analysis.name: Adverse events - outer retinal folds
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: "Patients were randomized 1:1 using random permutated blocks of varying sizes, stratified by site." According to the protocol (supplement 1), centrally administered method was used to conceal allocation.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Patients and researchers were not masked due to the nature of the intervention. There was unlikely deviations from the interventions in the trial context. The authors used modified ITT analysis, i.e., complete case analysis with sensitiity analysis to assess potential risks of "missingness not at random."
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: Data for this outcome was available for all participants randomized.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: Proportions of patients with selected ocular adverse events were measured and reported.
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: Proportions of patients with selected ocular adverse events were analyzed and reported.
Overall.bias.support: The trial was judged to have an overall low risk of bias.
